summary: This is an email chain from October 19, 2020, discussing logistical challenges in meeting a discovery deadline for the Epstein/Maxwell case. The primary issues involve making copies of documents, the unavailability of a CART analyst, and concerns about reviewers finishing their work in time for the November 9 deadline.

events.title: Internal Review Deadline
events.description: The legal team has set an internal deadline for reviewers to finish their work, ahead of the formal discovery deadline, to allow time for review of coding and copying.

events.title: Discovery Production Deadline
events.description: The formal deadline for producing discovery materials in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The document reveals internal pressure and logistical hurdles within the legal team to meet a November 9, 2020 discovery deadline in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
A CART analyst assigned to the case was out of the office, creating a bottleneck for making necessary copies, and the FBI had apparently backed out from assisting with this task.
The team set an aggressive internal deadline of October 31 for reviewers to finish, indicating a tight timeline and concern about missing the court-ordered production date.
